title: Lithivore
data:
A **lithivore** is a monster attribute that appears in [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") and [GnollHack](/wiki/GnollHack "GnollHack"). Lithivorous monsters are capable of eating [bone](/wiki/Bone "Bone"), [gemstone](/wiki/Gemstone "Gemstone"), [glass](/wiki/Glass "Glass") and [minerals](/wiki/Mineral "Mineral").

The presence of a [YAFM](/wiki/YAFM "YAFM") in the source code of *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")* for eating a [flint stone](/wiki/Flint_stone "Flint stone") suggests that the DevTeam may have considered including the ability to eat stone at some point - this is considered a [deferred feature](/wiki/Deferred_feature "Deferred feature"), since it has yet to be implemented as of the latest stable version.[\[1\]](#cite_note-flint-1) SlashTHEM prints this message whenever you eat a non-[cursed](/wiki/Cursed "Cursed") flint stone.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Description](#Description)

  - [1.1 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)
  - [1.2 GnollHack](#GnollHack)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 Messages](#Messages)
  - [3.1 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM_2)

- [4 See also](#See_also)

- [5 References](#References)

## Description

Lithivores can eat any items made of glass, mineral, bone or gemstone - this includes (but is not limited to) all [gems](/wiki/Gem "Gem"), [rocks](/wiki/Rock "Rock") and [gray stones](/wiki/Gray_stone "Gray stone"), as well as all [potions](/wiki/Potion "Potion"), [crysknives](/wiki/Crysknives "Crysknives") and mineral [rings](/wiki/Ring "Ring"); eating a potion is the same as [quaffing](/wiki/Quaff "Quaff") one in practice. These objects are also considered [treats](/wiki/Treat "Treat") for [pet](/wiki/Pet "Pet") lithivores. Polymorphing into a lithivore allows you to eat the same types of objects.

### SlashTHEM

In SlashTHEM, the following monsters are lithivores:

- [Rock moles](/wiki/Rock_mole "Rock mole")
- Baby and adult [stone dragons](/wiki/Stone_dragon "Stone dragon")
- [Xorns](/wiki/Xorn "Xorn")
- [Greater xorns](/index.php?title=Greater_xorn\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Greater xorn (page does not exist)")

### GnollHack

In GnollHack, the following monsters are lithivores:

- Rock moles
- [baby purple worm](/wiki/Baby_purple_worm "Baby purple worm")
- [purple worm](/wiki/Purple_worm "Purple worm")

## Strategy

In SlashTHEM, [rocks](/wiki/Rock "Rock") are by far the most common type of lithivorous 'food' a player will encounter, and make a plentiful source of nutrition for a pet lithivore - a single rock alone provides 250 points of nutrition. However, valuable tools such as [unicorn horns](/wiki/Unicorn_horn "Unicorn horn"), [figurines](/wiki/Figurine "Figurine") and [crystal balls](/wiki/Crystal_ball "Crystal ball") can be eaten as well, so avoid leaving them around such monsters (particularly [pets](/wiki/Pet "Pet")) if possible.

Players may also [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") into lithivoric monsters such as xorns for relatively standard reasons such as [eating jewelry](/wiki/Eating_jewelry "Eating jewelry"), as well as somewhat more unorthodox uses - e.g., you can eat away an annoying [loadstone](/wiki/Loadstone "Loadstone") weighing you down.

## Messages

### SlashTHEM

- You hear a grating sound.

  A monster is eating stone somewhere on the current level.

- Yabba-dabba-delicious!

  You ate a non-cursed flint stone while in the form of a lithivore; this [exercises](/wiki/Exercise "Exercise") [constitution](/wiki/Constitution "Constitution").[\[1\]](#cite_note-flint-1)

## See also

- [Diet](/wiki/Diet "Diet")

## References

1. ↑ [1.0](#cite_ref-flint_1-0) [1.1](#cite_ref-flint_1-1) [src/eat.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 2143](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/eat.c#L2143): *the line in SlashTHEM is unchanged from vanilla NetHack*

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
Lithivore

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

A lithivore is a monster attribute that appears in SlashTHEM and GnollHack. Lithivorous monsters are capable of eating bone, gemstone, glass and minerals.

The presence of a YAFM in the source code of NetHack for eating a flint stone suggests that the DevTeam may have considered including the ability to eat stone at some point - this is considered a deferred feature, since it has yet to be implemented as of the latest stable version.[1] SlashTHEM prints this message whenever you eat a non-cursed flint stone.

Contents

  • 1 Description
    • 1.1 SlashTHEM
    • 1.2 GnollHack
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 Messages
    • 3.1 SlashTHEM
  • 4 See also
  • 5 References

Description

Lithivores can eat any items made of glass, mineral, bone or gemstone - this includes (but is not limited to) all gems, rocks and gray stones, as well as all potions, crysknives and mineral rings; eating a potion is the same as quaffing one in practice. These objects are also considered treats for pet lithivores. Polymorphing into a lithivore allows you to eat the same types of objects.

SlashTHEM

In SlashTHEM, the following monsters are lithivores:

  • Rock moles
  • Baby and adult stone dragons
  • Xorns
  • Greater xorns

GnollHack

In GnollHack, the following monsters are lithivores:

  • Rock moles
  • baby purple worm
  • purple worm

Strategy

In SlashTHEM, rocks are by far the most common type of lithivorous 'food' a player will encounter, and make a plentiful source of nutrition for a pet lithivore - a single rock alone provides 250 points of nutrition. However, valuable tools such as unicorn horns, figurines and crystal balls can be eaten as well, so avoid leaving them around such monsters (particularly pets) if possible.

Players may also polymorph into lithivoric monsters such as xorns for relatively standard reasons such as eating jewelry, as well as somewhat more unorthodox uses - e.g., you can eat away an annoying loadstone weighing you down.

Messages

SlashTHEM

You hear a grating sound.
A monster is eating stone somewhere on the current level.
Yabba-dabba-delicious!
You ate a non-cursed flint stone while in the form of a lithivore; this exercises constitution.[1]

See also

  • Diet

References

  1. ↑ 1.0 1.1 src/eat.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 2143: the line in SlashTHEM is unchanged from vanilla NetHack
Retrieved from "https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Lithivore&oldid=167164"

rawPage:
A '''lithivore''' is a monster attribute that appears in [[SlashTHEM]] and [[GnollHack]]. Lithivorous monsters are capable of eating [[bone]], [[gemstone]], [[glass]] and [[mineral]]s.

The presence of a [[YAFM]] in the source code of ''[[NetHack]]'' for eating a [[flint stone]] suggests that the DevTeam may have considered including the ability to eat stone at some point - this is considered a [[deferred feature]], since it has yet to be implemented as of the latest stable version.{{refsrc|src/eat.c|2143|version=NetHack 3.6.7|name="flint"|comment=the line in SlashTHEM is unchanged from vanilla NetHack}} SlashTHEM prints this message whenever you eat a non-[[cursed]] flint stone.

==Description==
Lithivores can eat any items made of glass, mineral, bone or gemstone - this includes (but is not limited to) all [[gem]]s, [[rock]]s and [[gray stone]]s, as well as all [[potion]]s, [[crysknives]] and mineral [[ring]]s; eating a potion is the same as [[quaff]]ing one in practice. These objects are also considered [[treat]]s for [[pet]] lithivores. Polymorphing into a lithivore allows you to eat the same types of objects.

===SlashTHEM===
In SlashTHEM, the following monsters are lithivores:

* [[Rock mole]]s
* Baby and adult [[stone dragon]]s
* [[Xorn]]s
* [[Greater xorn]]s

===GnollHack===
In GnollHack, the following monsters are lithivores:

* Rock moles
* [[baby purple worm]]
* [[purple worm]]

==Strategy==
In SlashTHEM, [[rock]]s are by far the most common type of lithivorous 'food' a player will encounter, and make a plentiful source of nutrition for a pet lithivore - a single rock alone provides 250 points of nutrition. However, valuable tools such as [[unicorn horn]]s, [[figurine]]s and [[crystal ball]]s can be eaten as well, so avoid leaving them around such monsters (particularly [[pet]]s) if possible.

Players may also [[polymorph]] into lithivoric monsters such as xorns for relatively standard reasons such as [[eating jewelry]], as well as somewhat more unorthodox uses - e.g., you can eat away an annoying [[loadstone]] weighing you down.

==Messages==
===SlashTHEM===
{{message|You hear a grating sound.|A monster is eating stone somewhere on the current level.}}
{{message|Yabba-dabba-delicious!|You ate a non-cursed flint stone while in the form of a lithivore; this [[exercise]]s [[constitution]].<ref name="flint"/>}}

==See also==
* [[Diet]]
